captions.text:
My name is Corey Martinez
and I am a professional BMX rider.

I'm bringing my friends on this trip
to go film and ride motorcycles,

go camping and
just enjoy the open air.
[Red Bull Ride & Seek]

Atlanta is like one of the
dopest cities I've ever been to ride,
it's got a lot of untouched spots.

Happened to come by a school
that I had been to a few years ago.

I know we were here 
a few hours last fall here

so try to check it out 
and see what we find.
Watch your head.

[inaudible] super sick grind, switch 180,
[inaudible] like planning their thing
off this crazy curb rail hop.

He did the 180 super [inaudible]
a couple times, like almost like past 180,
and there was a wall right after it.
I hate my life.
Finally like... did it, he got by the wall.

And he landed right away 
and he gets to chill.

We actually got a hotel
because we want to stay in the city

and then out of nowhere
Van Homan shows up.
This trip just got ten times better.

It's really cool going on the trip with
Corey now because he's grown a lot.
from when I first met him.

You know, Van and I talk about
somehow we're still in this together.

We're still riding and doing
what we love after 10+ years.
This is a good setup.

Van seemed real interested in trying
to learn how to ride a motorcycle.
He's never done it.

I had my first motorcycle experience
in the parking lot this weekend.

My first lap around the
parking lot went fairly well

so I got a little cocky
and hit the throttle a little hard

and I tried to run into a parked car
but I think I saved it pretty good.
Watch it! Watch it!
[laughter]

Glad the bike was alright, 'cause 
I was kinda like, mid-point of the trip,

if you ruin the bike
it would suck.
How did I end up on a motorcycle trip?
[laughter]
[motorcycle revving]

As soon as we arrived
in the gap to rail session,

like within minutes
Brian pulls in and it's like,
man, this is like a dream trip.

I'm Brian Kachinsky, I'm 31 years old,
and I'm from Chicago, Illinois.

I was probably 12, 13 years old,
got that BMX bike, and that was

like my ticket to explore
beyond my comfort zone,

explore beyond my original confines,
you know, of whatever I could walk to.

So now I had this new vehicle
where I could essentially just go
discover new things and do it with friends.

My Ride & Seek adventure
started out in Atlanta.

It's funny just starting
the trip at the Gap to Rail,

you know, literally walking up the steps,
shaking everyone's hand,

hugging everyone,
then just putting my bike together
and right away just getting it in.
Woahhhhhh!

I've never really done a
gap rail like this big I guess.

Like it's not like big, it's long,
so usually it's kind of like

steep dive into rails,
so it should be interesting.

Really dope to see Fudger do a gap to rail,
I know Fudger's good at riding,

I always see footage of him,
but it's like really rare that
I get to actually watch him ride.

Fudger just warmed up the rail for me,
let's see if I can get his back.

Corey is a perfectionist, so you know,
like he got to the rail, like gap iced it

three or four times
just to like, you know,
make sure he had the distance right.

And then he got to
over iced it very first try,

but I think he just wasn't happy
with how much of the rail he got.

I like seeing how gap over switch ice,
he got a good part of it and just
leaned into it, it was so perfect.
How much did I get?
Hey!
Should I slow it down?
How much did I get?
Everything!

All of it, all that you needed.
That was sick as fuck!
[motorcycle noises]

As soon as we got to these blue rails,
Van just laid down the first line,

and I think that just 
got everybody hyped.
Wooo!!
Wassup?
That was awesome!

I don't know if this is good for it
to build the strength back up--
Yeah.

--or hurting it, cause it doesn't hurt
enough to where I'm like, aw can't ride.
Kachinsky... he's going to go hard.

He always does, and I think that's why
he's one of my favorites to watch.

He's going to be crazy,
he's going to be moving fast,
he's going to be scary tricks.

[ON THE NEXT
RIDE AND SEEK]

We got to a big four block
and there was a big grass hill.

As soon as I saw that,
you had to start jumping down it.

After we passed through Atlanta,
I think we were all ready for like

a little break at
a water hole at some point.
[motorcycle engine revving]

title: Ride and Seek - Gap to Rails in Atlanta - Ep 7
